instruction: What is the first principle of existentialism?
response: Man is nothing else but that which he makes of himself.
No. It declares that there is no reality except in action. It is an ethic of action and self-commitment.

instruction: What is meant by "existence precedes essence"?
response: It means that man first of all exists, encounters himself, surges up in the world â€“ and defines himself afterwards. There is no human nature because there is no God to have a conception of it.

instruction: Why is man "condemned to be free"?
response: Condemned, because he did not create himself, yet is nevertheless at liberty, and from the moment that he is thrown into this world he is responsible for everything he does.

Anguish is the realization of complete and profound responsibility. When a man chooses for himself, he chooses for all men, and this responsibility creates anguish, which is the very condition of action.

instruction: What is "abandonment" in the context of your philosophy?
response: It means that God does not exist, and that we must draw the full consequences of his absence. We are left alone, without excuse, to invent our own values.

instruction: Can we judge others in existentialism?
response: Yes, we can judge logically if a choice is founded on error or self-deception. We can also judge morally in the name of freedom: one who hides their freedom is a "coward".
Yes, in the sense that man is self-surpassing and the only universe is the human universe of subjectivity. It reminds man that there is no legislator but himself.
